fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e1.equipments.heater

Interface HeaterExternalControlI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HeaterTemperatureI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    HeaterExternalControlCI, HeaterExternalControlJava4CI, HeaterUserCI, HeaterUserI, HeaterUserJava4CI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Heater, HeaterExternalControlConnector, HeaterExternalControlInboundPort, HeaterExternalControlJava4InboundPort, HeaterExternalControlOutboundPort, HeaterUserConnector, HeaterUserInboundPort, HeaterUserJava4InboundPort, HeaterUserOutboundPort

    public interface HeaterExternalControlI
extends HeaterTemperatureI
    The interface HeaterExternalControlI declares the signatures of service implementations accessible to the external controller.

    Description

    Invariants

     invariant       POWER_UNIT != null
 invariant       TENSION_UNIT != null
 invariant       MAX_POWER_LEVEL != null && MAX_POWER_LEVEL.getMeasurementUnit().equals(POWER_UNIT) && MAX_POWER_LEVEL.getData() > 0.0
 invariant       VOLTAGE != null && VOLTAGE.getMeasurementUnit().equals(TENSION_UNIT) && VOLTAGE.getData() == 220.0
 invariant       getCurrentPowerLevel().getData() <= getMaxPowerLevel().getData()

    Created on : 2023-09-18

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • getMaxPowerLevel

                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        return the maximum power of the heater in the power unit used by the heater.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    return != null && return.getData() > 0.0 && return.getMeasurementUnit().equals(POWER_UNIT)

      • setCurrentPowerLevel

        void setCurrentPowerLevel(Measure<java.lang.Double> powerLevel)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        set the power level of the heater; if powerLevel.getData() > getMaxPowerLevel().getData() then set the power level to the maximum.

        Contract

         pre     on()
 pre     powerLevel != null && powerLevel.getData() >= 0.0 && powerLevel.getMeasurementUnit().equals(POWER_UNIT)
 post    powerLevel.getData() > getMaxPowerLevel().getData() || getCurrentPowerLevel().getData() == powerLevel.getData()
 post    powerLevel.getData() <= getMaxPowerLevel().getData() || getCurrentPowerLevel().getData() == Heater.MAX_POWER_LEVEL.getData()
        Parameters:
        powerLevel - the powerLevel to be set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

 post    return != null && return.getMeasure().getMeasurementUnit().equals(POWER_UNIT)
 post    return.getMeasure().getData() >= 0.0 && return.getMeasure().getData() <= getMaxPowerLevel().getData()
